ygData.subject: Juggling justified
ygData.msgSnippet: This is an idea that occurred to me in the time when all I can do is THINK about EQ. Perhaps the bards magical songs are short. Perhaps the magic is a short
ygData.messageBody:
This is an idea that occurred to me in the time when all I can do is
THINK about EQ. Perhaps the bards magical songs are short. Perhaps the
magic is a short spell set to music. Each tick then, is one singing of
the spell. If you sing for multiple ticks, you sing the spell multiple
times. Twisting then is singing one spell, and then another, and back.

Though a bard is an entertainer and a storyteller, is it not right to
say that the songs with magical effects are not meant for
entertainment?

I'm not saying it would sound pretty to sing one song then another, but
this explanation felt better to me than to think that I am singing two
songs at the same time.

Mandibal
Travelling Trouvere
Now Performing at the Guard Post in West Commons
Cazic-Thule

Message: 4
Date: Sun, 16 May 1999 15:49:48 -0700 (PDT)
From: Kristian Leitzen <kleit@...>
Subject: Re: juggling justified

I am also a RL musician, and i don't think that anyone, no matter what
you try to say on here, sings one verse of one song, then one verse of
another song, then the second verse of the first song, then the second
verse of the second song, etc. if you do then you are annoying the
hell out of everybody. this is what i mean when i say that a bard
wouldn't do it. a bard is proud of his singing and wouldn't want to
appear foolish even if it did boost his stats. this is all IMHO by the
way. everyone is free to their own opinion.
Olczyk
